subject: RE: [junit] Re: ClassDefNotFound Errors
msgSnippet: ... I had a similar problem, but it was the other way around (I think). In any case, I ended up using the following sort of thing (see below) and it helped to
messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Angela Day [mailto:akcday@...]
> Sent: Friday, November 12, 2004 9:45 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Re: ClassDefNotFound Errors
>
> John,
> Sorry for the confusing. No, I am using the Run as -> JUnit Test
> from within JUnit. When I do run the tests from the command line,
> thought, they fail with errors.
> Thanks,
> Angela

I had a similar problem, but it was the other way around (I think). In any
case, I ended up using the following sort of thing (see below) and it helped
to clear up the problem.

Thanks

<target name="checkforeclipse" depends="setup" if="eclipse.running">
<path id="classpath">
<path refid="base.classpath"/>
</path>
<property name="build.compiler"
value="org.eclipse.jdt.core.JDTCompilerAdapter"/>
<!--property name="junit.jar" value="${JUNIT}"/--><!-- does
not work even though the JUNIT variable is defined in
eclipse|windows|preferences|java|classpath vairables!-->
<property name="junit.jar" value="C:\Program
Files\Development\eclipse\plugins\org.junit_3.8.1\junit.jar"/>
</target>
<target name="checkforother" depends="setup"
unless="eclipse.running">
<echo message="ant.home=${ant.home}"/>
<echo message="junit.jar=${junit.jar}"/>
<property name="junit.jar"
value="${ant.home}/lib/junit.jar"/><!-- usually one hangs out here -->
<path id="classpath">
<path refid="base.classpath"/>
<!--add xml stuff here since out target is 1.3-->
<pathelement path="${lib.path}/xml-apis.jar"/>
<pathelement path="${lib.path}/xalan.jar"/>
<pathelement path="${lib.path}/xercesImpl.jar"/>
</path>
</target>
<target name="check" depends="checkforeclipse,checkforother">
<echo message="junit.jar=${junit.jar}"/><!-- this has /'s
and \'s on windoze xp! -->
<fail unless="junit.jar">no junit.jar!</fail>
</target>
<target name="init" depends="check" description="init">
<mkdir dir="bin"/>
</target>
